dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description: IBM MPI implementation from Spectrum MPI.
dependencies.name: mpi

description:
The NAS Parallel Benchmarks (NPB) are a small set of programs designed
to help evaluate the performance of parallel supercomputers. The
benchmarks are derived from computational fluid dynamics (CFD)
applications and consist of five kernels and three pseudo-applications
in the original "pencil-and-paper" specification (NPB 1). The benchmark
suite has been extended to include new benchmarks for unstructured
adaptive mesh, parallel I/O, multi-zone applications, and computational
grids. Problem sizes in NPB are predefined and indicated as different
classes. Reference implementations of NPB are available in commonly-used
programming models like MPI and OpenMP (NPB 2 and NPB 3).
name: npb

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system

variants.description: Selects one among the available implementations
variants.name: implementation
